descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...pattern
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...horizontally

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...pattern
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...horizontally

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...pattern
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...horizontally

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black grid with colored blocks that repeat a cross pattern
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...triples in length vertically while remaining the same width
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill two blocks with red vertically underneath each side of the single red square as shown above. repeat until reaching the bottom of the grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... the size of the pattern of the input grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same horizontally and multiplied by 3 vertically and add 1
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... change the pattern vertically and horizontally

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black and light blue square,3x20
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...double the height of the grid.Copy exact.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a row of patterned grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the width is the same as the input grid and the height is the number of the vertical input grid multiplied by 3.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... create the grid. Then copy the original pattern onto the output grid. Next, create a mirror pattern from the original pattern underneath the original pattern. Then copy the whole original and mirror pattern to fill in the rest of the black grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... the blue shapes
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to....the way

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a pattern composed of blue or red squares
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...if blue grid will be 17x9 if Red grid will be 17x13
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...if blue squares continue the pattern all the way to the end. If red do the same thing. It will be the same top and bottom.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two input grids, one using red boxes is four boxes high and the other using blue boxes is three boxes high.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...changes in height only. The first grid goes from four to thirteen boxes, and the second goes from three to nine boxes. The length remains the same for both grids.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the original pattern into the top of the grid, then the next few rows you create a mirror image of the first pattern using the same colors, so that it is upside down. The bottom half of the first grid is then a mirror image of the top half.  The same process is used for the second grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x17 or 4x17 pattern
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same horizontally and multiplied by 3 vertically (and add 1)
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...flip the pattern vertically 3 times to create a continuous pattern that is symmetrical both vertically and horizontally
